 "Vladimir R. Bossicard" <vladimir@...> wrote:The ResourceManager of the JUnit-addons package could maybe help you (never
tried this situation (rerunning an individual test):

  protected File data1;

  public void setUp() {
     data1 = (File) ResourceManager.getResource("data1");
     if (data1 == null) {
        data1 = new File(".../data1.txt");
        ResourceManager.addResource("data1", data1);
     }
  }

the tests should be able to share the same data1 object.

-Vladimir
